intro: Cestichis cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's cestichis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest environments. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and berries as its fruit type. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
